result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifton J Coleman III

Defendant Clifton J Coleman III in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Clifton J Coleman III.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea hearing. Defense counsel provides an update to the court regarding the recent filing of their motion to suppress and motion for leave of court. Court further schedules the next court date for a motion hearing date and sets 01/27/2022 deadline for the state's response. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Motion hearing scheduled for February 10, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion for Leave of Court
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-11-22

Defendant Clifton J Coleman III in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Clifton J Coleman III.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel advises that this case will no longer be considered as part of the global resolution. Further, defense requests an adjournment due to reasons put forth on the record. No objections from the State. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court with attorney Michael G. Levine and attorney John Binder.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, defense advises that there may be a possible global resolution. Judge Grayson authorizes transfer to Br 10, shall Judge Havas accept case for global resolution. Case adjourned for a PGP date to Br 16.
  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 08-03-2022

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court with attorney Michael G. Levine, both by zoom.  Patrick T. Franken for Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clifton J Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for hearing.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Request for substitution made by Defense Counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 9.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brittany Grayson, Branch 16.  Pretrial conference VACATED.  Case scheduled for pretrial conference, Branch 9, by ZOOM.  Court scheduled deadline to file any motions by August 3, 2022.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Request for Substitution of Judge

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court with attorney Michael P. Moran.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed on 06/03/2022. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court sets deadline for the State to confirm that all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, to be turned over to defense for 07/08/2022. Court sets 08/03/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court, appear in person with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Gregg Herman appears in person Thomas Potter appears by video for the the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer R. Cepican. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for a hearing. Court was notified by the public defenders office that attorney Lori Kuehn will be appointed to the case. Court scheduled a preliminary hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court, appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Clifton J Coleman in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Clifton J Coleman in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
